p: The possible role of colchicine was hypothesized versus COVID-19 infection. Ito et al. highlighted how SARS-CoV and its accessory protein could activate pro-IL-1Î² gene transcription and protein maturation, and subsequently, NLRP3 inflammasome [ 96]. Indeed, the anti-inflammatory activity of colchicine mainly depends on the inhibition of the NLRP3 inflammasome [ 97]. Other anti-COVID-19 mechanism have been proposed [ 98].
